channel.title: The Bethesda Podcast
channel.description: The Bethesda Podcast takes you behind the scenes with the award-winning video game developers responsible for The Elder Scrolls, RAGE, Fallout, DOOM, Brink, QUAKE, Hunted: The Demon's Forge and more. Episodes will include exclusive interviews and updates on upcoming Bethesda games, along with an inside look at the world of game development.
channel.itunes:subtitle: The Bethesda Podcast
channel.itunes:summary: The Bethesda Podcast takes you behind the scenes with the award-winning video game developers responsible for The Elder Scrolls, RAGE, Fallout, DOOM, Brink, QUAKE, Hunted: The Demon's Forge and more. Episodes will include exclusive interviews and updates on upcoming Bethesda games, along with an inside look at the world of game development.
channel.itunes:author: Bethesda Softworks
channel.itunes:keywords: bethesda, softworks, games, fallout, elder, rage, brink, doom, quake, oblivion, zenimax, scrolls

item.title: Episode 1
item.description: Matt and Nick sit down for an interview with id Software's Tim Willits and Bethesda Game Studios' Todd Howard at QuakeCon. Also: an update on Fallout: New Vegas with senior producer Jason Bergman, including an exclusive sample of music from the game.

item.title: Episode 2: The Werewolf's Lair
item.description: We kick off this week's episode with a few stories from PAX and a big bag of reader mail. Then a short tale about the first QuakeCon is told, and Harvey Smith and Raphael Colantonio of Arkane Studios join us to talk about immersive games.

item.title: Episode 3: Parity Error
item.description: It's a Fallout: New Vegas special as senior producer Jason Bergman stops by to answer your questions about the game. Later on, Obsidian CEO Feargus Urquhart drops in for a long talk about New Vegas.

item.title: Episode 4: Let's Tango
item.description: Matt and Nick welcome a new member to the growing ZeniMax family. Then it's on to a long talk with Fallout: New Vegas Official Game Guide writer David Hodgson, who divulges plenty of hints and tips for would-be wastelanders.

item.title: Episode 5: John Carmack
item.description: id Software co-founder and technical director John Carmack joins us for a long discussion on topics ranging from the development of RAGE Mobile to space exploration and Ferraris. Also featured on the podcast is Bethesda Game Studios level designer Joel Burgess, who shares advice on breaking into the video game industry.

item.title: Episode 6: Enter the Dragon
item.description: Following the announcement of The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim, Bethesda Game Studios executive game director Todd Howard chats about the exciting, cathartic reveal.

item.title: Episode 7: Hines Catch-up
item.description: On the outset of Bethesda's biggest year yet, Pete Hines stops by to talk about all the excitement and take your questions.

item.title: Episode 8: Oblivion 5th Anniversary Special
item.description: Last week we marked the fifth anniversary of The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion's release. In this special edition of the podcast, listen as key team members recount their memories of working on the landmark project, followed by a roundtable discussion with Todd Howard and Pete Hines.

item.title: Episode 9: On the Brink of Hunted
item.description: With Brink launching tomorrow in North America, we plug Splash Damage's Ed Stern for all the info he can manage. Later, we explore the depths of Hunted: The Demon's Forge with Bethesda's David Clayman.

item.title: Episode 10: Eat, Prey (2), Love
item.description: Matt and Nick talk Prey 2 with Human Head co-founders Jim Sumwalt and Chris Rhinehart.

item.title: Episode 11: QuakeCon Special Edition Podcast
item.description: Take a trip down memory lane with members of id Software, as they discuss the company's early years, the magic of QuakeCon, and what fans can expect out of RAGE at this year's event. Podcast features John Carmack, Tim Willits, Matt Hooper, Marty Stratton, Jonathan Wright, and 'id Mom' Donna Jackson.

item.title: Episode 12: Dishonored to Meet You
item.description: Dishonored co-directors Raphael Colantonio and Harvey Smith join us once again to discuss their recently announced immersive action game.

item.title: Skyrim Podcast #1: Completely Blue Sky - The Concept of Skyrim
item.description: The first installment of the Skyrim team diaries features concept artists Adam Adamowicz and Ray Lederer.

item.title: Skyrim Podcast #2: Making a Dragon Sandwich: The Sound of Skyrim
item.description: Go behind the scenes with Skyrim audio director Mark Lampert.

item.title: Skyrim Podcast #3: Reaching New Heights: The World of Skyrim
item.description: The world and character artists that brought Skyrim to life tell their tales.

item.title: Skyrim Podcast #4: A Big Mountain to Climb: Animating Skyrim
item.description: Members of the Skyrim animation team recall key moments of development.

item.title: Episode 13: Skyrim Modding Special
item.description: Valve's Dave Sawyer and Bethesda's Joel Burgess join us as we delve into the past, present and future of Skyrim modding support.

item.title: Dishonored Podcast #1: One Kicked Bottle: The Sandbox of Dishonored
item.description: The team at Arkane joins us to explain the unpredictable magic of Dishonored's dark sandbox playground.
